content: If the password is correct, then the error is either in a misspelling of email address or an error in the server setup. Thunderbird is only reporting the message received from the server.
creator: davidsk

content:
Are they shown in the 'account settings' pane? you can also check to see what is in the profile itself. to do that, follow these steps: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down left side to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile' - now, you are in the profile. if the missing accounts are IMAP, click the imapmail folder to see if the accounts are listed. if the accounts are POP, look in the Mail folder

Yes, you can revert to a prior version of thunderbird, but that won't find missing accounts - unless you installed a new version of thunderbird with a new profile. Let us know status.
creator: davidsk

content: Check to see if your antivirus or vpn is interferring with thunderbird. What you are describing is a situation where thunderbird is being prevented from shutting down successfully. That is when the prefs.js file in the profile is updated with all updates from current execution. It might also be a situation where the prefs.js is read-only. If you browse the profile and see multiple instances of the prefs.js, that is also an indication of interference during shutdown. Please post results.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you David. There are 40 prefs files in my profile folder, all dated more than a year ago but the problem only appeared this week after I added the new email account. content: Zonder Thunderbird bij de hand en vertaald uit het Engels: Ga naar Adresboek Selecteer Persoonlijk adresboek Klik met de rechtermuisknop of klik op (...) 3 puntjes Selecteer Exporteren Opslaan als CSV of selecteer de indeling Wijzig de bestandsnaam en locatie naar wens.
